primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, motivated by His eternal nature as Love (Agape), initiates a 'love affair' with humanity, seeking reunion with the separated and unworthy through the sacrifice of Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically as the Father and the 'Fairer One' Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: God was at work there [Calvary], in our interest and at a great cost.
A fairer one than any village lad threw himself into death's awful waters for you and for me.
an outgoing goodwill, a drive, an urge toward reunion of the separated
love was operating, God's love, far back in the misty, nebulous, indescribable nonregions of eternity.
He first loved us... in all of our unworthiness, in all of our rebelliousness and selfishness.
Would he devote that sacred head For such a worm as I?

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (as the Mediator/Hero) and the Holy Spirit (as Companion)
tekstueel_bewijs: Christ died for you and me.
There is a Holy Spirit who loves us by companionship and guidance.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and Human Resistance (the 'locked door')
tekstueel_bewijs: locked tight against them when they come with nothing more than their key of authority
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as 'death's awful waters' and an ontological separation that requires a divine 'drive toward reunion' that human power cannot bridge.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of love toward God and neighbor as a reflection of the primary love received.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Love for neighbor (political empowerment, feeding the hungry)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher explicitly states that human love is a 'faint reflection' and 'springs from' the central sun of God's love. The secondary program is strictly a consequence of the first.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Christ/Spirit → God the Father ← Sin/Death/Human Will

voorbeelden_god_subject: God's love touches that part of his creation.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we can turn back to him some faint reflection
we ought to exercise our Christian love
we love because God first loved us

voorbeelden: love of God demands love of people
command an eager willingness, a glad yes in our inmost souls
Jesus kept telling us that the only way we can somewhat grasp...
Tanks, rockets... have no power to win the soul's inward yes.
we are so limited, so frail, so feeble

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human LACK of power (Pouvoir) to open the 'private door' and God's sovereign power to do so through love. It is a theology of enablement rather than obligation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the 'Prodigal' (Not-S2) to the 'Test' (Not-S1), proving human failure, then to the 'Hero' who enters S2 (Death) to bring the hearer to S1 (Agape).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary: Christ enters the 'eddy' of death to save the 'idiot' (humanity).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Death is described as 'awful waters' and sin as 'rebelliousness'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is overwhelmingly theocentric. God is the initiator, the actor, and the sustainer. Human action is framed strictly as a 'faint reflection' of divine action.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we ought to exercise our Christian love to God by loving each other to empowerment.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He first loved when there was nothing to love except his own intention.
A fairer one than any village lad threw himself into death's awful waters for you and for me.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Moses, Hosea) are used to illustrate God's character, not as models for human imitation.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The Father of the Prodigal (as a metaphor for God)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: the focus is on the Father's watching, not the son's returning.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and gratitude; removal of the burden of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace: salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Primary Program' (God's love) to the 'Secondary Program' (Social action) is logically linked via the metaphor of 'reflection' and 'rays from the sun'.
spanning_punten: The shift to Brooklyn politics feels slightly more 'Devoir' (obligation) than the rest of the sermon, but is anchored in the 'Agape' definition.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: this brave, talented lad leapt into the water and saved the other... and was himself drowned.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides 'companionship and guidance'—a modal endowment of 'Savoir' and 'Pouvoir'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; humans are 'trash' and 'idiots' in the face of the 'raging river' of death/sin.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of all redemptive verbs. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver of an unmerited gift.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic 'Grace' structure.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Secondary Program' (political action) is even more explicitly tied to the Spirit's power rather than just human 'ought'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining the 'Grammar of Grace'. It avoids the trap of turning the Prodigal Son into a story about 'how to repent' and instead keeps the focus on the Father's 'God-illumined' love.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'love' metaphors, Greimasian analysis reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the Subject-switch where Christ takes the place of the 'idiot' in the Axis of Power.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Greek word 'Agape'; semiotics shows how 'Agape' functions as a 'Sender' that mandates the 'Subject' (God) to act.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'private door' is a semiotic boundary that only the 'Agape' actant can cross, rendering all other actants (Law, Church, School) as 'Opponents' or 'Ineffective Helpers'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Hero' narrative (the village idiot story) to perfectly mirror the substitutionary atonement model.
